description:
Reported on IRC: 

the docs say 'nova-manage vpn run <projectname>'. My nova-manage rejects that and says the proper syntax is nova-manage vpn run --project=<proj> --user=<user>

Need to do a run-through both the openstack-manuals docs and the nova docs to see if we can clean that up for Diablo.

Documenting nova-manage is a little dicey since it doesn't work with Keystone used for auth. Be sure to indicate that in any sections about nova-manage.
title: Cleanup on nova-manage commands

comments.content:
Reported on IRC: 

the docs say 'nova-manage vpn run <projectname>'. My nova-manage rejects that and says the proper syntax is nova-manage vpn run --project=<proj> --user=<user>

Need to do a run-through both the openstack-manuals docs and the nova docs to see if we can clean that up for Diablo.

Documenting nova-manage is a little dicey since it doesn't work with Keystone used for auth. Be sure to indicate that in any sections about nova-manage.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~annegentle

comments.content:
Found in openstack-manuals in ch_networking.xml:

http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/admin/content/restarting-and-logging-into-cloudpipe-vpn.html

Found in nova in doc/source/devref/cloudpipe.rst:

http://nova.openstack.org/devref/cloudpipe.html
